intro: Erechtites minimus, commonly known as the small bur marigold, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, which are often mistaken for petals. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Erechtites minimus thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
